item.title: Barplots Part 2 and Timeseries
item.description: Interactive Barplots Previously, we showed how to do basic barplots. Today we will use ggiraph in order to change our barplot to an interactive bar plot. We begin by loading in the necessary packages. library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(ggiraph) Then we will query the data and order it by most homeruns, similar to last time. df <- Teams%>% filter(yearID == 1980)%>% select(name , HR)%>% arrange(HR) df$name <- factor(df$name, levels = df$name) Now we will put the data into our plot.

item.title: Histograms and Barplots
item.description: Histograms A histogram is an accurate graphical representation of the distribution of numberical data. It takes one group of numerical data and places it along the x-axis seperating it into bins. This allows the researcher to do initial analysis to see how the data is distributed. For this example we will need these packages: library(Lahman) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(ggiraph) Now that we have the packages loaded in we want to query the database to select what data we want to visualize.

item.title: Making Scatterplots in R
